cyclone.name: MARIA
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across the Leeward Islands, then over the northeastern Caribbean Sea toward Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Puerto Rico (with the center passing very close to or over the U.S. Virgin Islands first)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Puerto Rico (including Vieques and Culebra) and portions of the northern Leeward Islands remain under Hurricane Watch; Tropical Storm Watches extend southward to Barbados and St. Vincent & the Grenadines.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Guadeloupe southward through Dominica, St. Kitts–Nevis–Montserrat, Martinique, St. Lucia, and the U.S. & British Virgin Islands.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and southern Leeward Islands, U.S. and British Virgin Islands, and Puerto Rico
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane conditions likely; 64-kt (74-mph) wind cumulative probability 61% with onset as early as Wednesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Dangerous surge of 6–9 ft above normal tide expected around the U.S. Virgin Islands, including St. Croix, accompanied by large destructive waves.
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–12 inches with isolated 20 inches possible, producing life-threatening flash floods and mudslides.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Life-threatening surf and rip currents; possible port inundation and debris from large waves.
